structure.unit: Courts, Judicial Officers And Proceedings In Civil Cases
Certain Writs And Proceedings In Special Cases

law.catch_line: Reversal Of Judgment For Plaintiff; New Action; Time Limit
law.text: If a judgment for the plaintiff is reversed for error, the plaintiff, or any person claiming under him, may commence a new action for the same cause within one year after the reversal of the judgment, and recover all damages sustained during the three years last preceding or at any time after the commencement of the original action.
